job_title: Associate Professor in Oxford, PA
pros:
I obtained my PhD degree from the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at the University of Texas at Arlington in August 2006. Currently, I am a lecturer at West Chester University of Pennsylvania and I have been an instructor and teaching assistant for several courses in the Computer Science and Mathematics departments and a research assistant during my graduate studies at the University of Texas at Arlington.
My current research is in the area of hierarchical reinforcement learning applied to Computer Games and Robotics. I have introduced a new method for a fast discovery of subgoals using Monte Carlo sampling. I have applied this method for construction of hierarchical action and state representations in reinforcement learning in order to accelerate learning and extend the scope of such systems. The main result of these techniques is to permit the transference of knowledge to subsequent tasks and acceleration of learning by creating corresponding subtask policies as abstract actions.
Important features of my background are my graduate and professional levels of experience in re- search, industries and teaching fields, where I maintained an open-minded and non-conservative approach to new problems and new ideas. Because teaching and research have an important place in my career goals, I have obtained a significant experience in both fields.
Among the most satisfying experiences for me have been my professional services such as recruit- ment of prospective students and participation in several volunteer activities for programming contests and science fairs. These activities have encouraged high school students to think about Computer Science as a possible university career and I plan to continue these activities at the department, university and regional levels.
I feel confident that my extensive interdisciplinary training and experience in major areas of Computer Science and Engineering will support my development of being well-published, well- funded and well-known in the scientific community through innovative research and teaching activities in your respected department.
Enclosed please find my research and teaching statements, my curriculum vitae and a list of my references. I would welcome an interview and I look forward to hearing from you.
cons: too much bureaucracy. lack of interest in technology, low salary,

review_title: It  has been an amazing experience, learned a lot. I would've liked to stay here longer but the renumeration is low.
job_title: Technical Assistant in Oxford, PA
pros:
Flexible hours and this motivate employees to  work well in their respective areas of expertise.
Friendly environment which also makes employees more productive.

Low pay (minimum wage), which is causing an exodus of talent

job_title: Communications in West Grove, PA
pros: Interacting with talented, dedicated employees from various department who want to see the legacy of Lincoln continue. Diverse student population.
cons: Low pay. Unrealistic expectations. Lack of resources to complete necessary tasks. When essential personnel leave or retire, organization is slow to replace and often loads work onto others. Organization often retains people at high levels who have proven themselves to be incompetent.

job_title: Resident Advisor in Lincoln University, PA
pros: Close bond with staff members, hardly any change in management over the course of 3 years, minority-based culture
cons: Low pay, poor treatment from Administration, not enough resources to effectively/efficiently perform staff tasks on a campus level (but it helped to implement essential skills... needed to work in these types of environments)
